newsitem.title: INDIA: Bombay sugar prices gain on fresh consumer demand.
newsitem.headline: Bombay sugar prices gain on fresh consumer demand.

text.p: Bombay sugar prices recovered on Monday after recent losses on renewed consumer demand and fresh retain interest, dealers said.

Ready delivery sugar S-30 moved up by 15 rupees to 1,235/1,275 rupees per quintal while M-30 rose by 10/18 rupees to 1,278/1,365 rupees. Sugar mill delivery also climbed up by 10 rupees to 1,175/1,195 rupees per quintal.
"Consumer demand remained high ahead of (next week's) Ramazan Moslem festival which also helped prices to bounce back from recent lower levels," one broker said.
